archimate:Assessment.name: Storage of data in unsuitable ways
archimate:Assessment.documentation:
When data is not organised for statistical processing, it can take up much more space than is needed, and be much slower than might be needed.
This is even the case, for databases that are meant to hold and provide statistics for time-series data - they're very fast for looking at events over a time frame, but found grouping and filtering over any other dimensions "aren't great".
